node.title: Idaho lawmakers pass Texas-style abortion bill that would let relatives sue
node.description: The House voted Monday to approve the legislation, which is modeled after a Texas law that the U.S. Supreme Court has allowed to remain in place until a court challenge is decided on its merits.

node.title: NASA continues to work with Russia on space station
node.description: Despite internet rumors, NASA says astronaut Mark Vande Hei will come home as planned aboard a Soyuz spacecraft.

node.title: Raskin nomination for Fed endangered by Manchin's opposition
node.description: His opposition could doom her confirmation prospects if Raskin can't pick up a Republican vote in the Senate.

node.title: Another pain of returning to the office? High gas prices.
node.description: Surging fuel costs — and more costly commutes — could complicate employers' efforts to call workers back to their desks.

node.title: Russian strike on Ukraine TV tower kills at least 9, officials say
node.description: An official posted pictures of firefighters using cranes to lift sections of shattered concrete and brick walls and carrying a stretcher.

node.title: Ginni Thomas says she went to January 6 rally before Capitol assault
node.description: Thomas told the Washington Free Beacon she "played no role with those who were planning and leading the January 6 events."

node.title: Fox News correspondent Benjamin Hall injured while reporting in Ukraine
node.description: It's not yet clear how he was injured or how severe his injuries are.

node.title: Over 40,000 Syrians reportedly register to fight for Russia in Ukraine
node.description: A notice was sent out to members of a militia that has been sanctioned by the U.S. for serving as an intermediary between the Assad regime and ISIS, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said.

node.title: On the Omicron frontline in South Auckland
node.description: South Auckland is once again bearing the brunt of a Covid-19 outbreak, but one Pacific health provider is doing everything it can to help families isolating at home.

node.title: Russia asks China for military help in war with Ukraine, U.S. officials say
node.description: The request included military aid and equipment, according to the officials.

node.title: Roadkill for food? One state now has an app for that
node.description: About 30 states allow people to eat animals killed by motor vehicles, but only the Cowboy State offers tech support.

node.title: Fan buys Tom Brady's "last" football for $518K — then Brady returns
node.description: Famed QB's return deflates worth of football he used before announcing his retirement last year.

node.title: Mets star Pete Alonso survives "brutal" car crash
node.description: Alonso said the accident will not impact his ability to play, and told reporters that he's "just really thankful to be alive."

node.title: Rushed review may open door to more mining on conservation land
node.description: Opinion: The government's plans to fast-track a review of some ecologically important land could result in the loss of legal protections for some conservation land, Matthew Hall and Allan Brent write.

node.title: Ampol plans to sell Gull Petroleum to Allegro Funds pending approvals
node.description: The country's third biggest fuel retailer, Gull Petroleum, is to get a new owner.

node.title: Betting on March Madness to top $3 billion, group predicts
node.description: Growth of legalized gambling has turned the annual championing into one of the biggest events for sports betting.

node.title: Covid-19: Ministry 'so far removed from the day-to-day lives of disabled people'
node.description: Concern about support for disabled people during the Omicron outbreak has prompted the Disability Rights Commissioner to launch an urgent inquiry that will examine the continuity of essential in-home…

node.title: Economists predict GDP growth in last quarter of 2021
node.description: GDP figures for the three months ended December are set to be released on Thursday, with some banks predicting a quarterly growth of about 3.5 percent as activity recovered.

node.title: Elderly, students going without food to afford rent, petrol
node.description: Sharply increasing costs of living are forcing vulnerable members of society to go without food as their budgets are squeezed.

node.title: Pro-Trump former Minnesota GOP chair running for late husband's House seat
node.description: Jennifer Carnahan resigned her position in August amid allegations of a toxic work environment and a close associate facing criminal charges.

node.title: US promises action if China provides 'lifeline to Russia' over Ukraine sanctions
node.description: US officials believe Russia has requested Chinese military supplies to help with the war effort, as well as economic support.

node.title: 3-year-old accidentally shoots mom to death in family's car
node.description: The family was sitting in their car outside a Food 4 Less store when the boy somehow found the gun and fired it, striking his mother, police said.

node.title: Govt to consider more measures to help address rising living costs
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says Cabinet will today look at the soaring cost of living and what the government can do to help. Audio

node.title: 'All round pretty irresponsible': Covid-19 fears for some after rowdy party
node.description: University of Canterbury's Ilam Fields has become home to uncontrolled parties taking place instead of traditional Orientation Week events, which were canned due to Covid-19 restrictions..

node.title: Pasifika warned to be vigilant against rheumatic fever
node.description: The parents of a young boy with rheumatic fever are urging adults, particularly in Pacific communities, to take sore throats and rashes in children seriously.

node.title: A record number of homes are now worth $1 million or more
node.description: Real estate prices surged during the pandemic, with 1 in 12 homes now worth at least $1 million, a new analysis finds.

node.title: Blues women champing at the bit for Super Rugby Aupiki debut
node.description: The Blues women have named six Black Ferns and two Black Ferns Sevens players in the starting XV for their first ever game of Super Rugby Aupiki.

node.title: Pfizer CEO says 4th dose of COVID vaccine "necessary," submits data to FDA
node.description: CEO Albert Bourla said the vaccine remains protective against hospitalizations and deaths, but "doesn't last very long" for warding off infections.

node.title: Biden may travel to Europe in coming weeks
node.description: The trip could include a stop in Brussels, Belgium, home of NATO headquarters.

node.title: Protesters seize London mansion linked to Russian oligarch
node.description: "This property has been liberated," read a banner unfurled by activists on the roof of the huge house in London's exclusive Belgravia neighborhood.
